title: How Popcorn Works | How Things Work with Kamri Noel
description:
Popcorn is a delicious snack, but Kamri Noel wants to know what makes it pop.

About How Things Work:
Kamri Noel does more than just Google how things work—she gets some of the world’s most knowledgeable experts from National Geographic to explain.

captions:
. KAMRI: Hey guys, it's Kamri.. My friends and I are
having a movie night. and I'm making some popcorn.. Popcorn is just one of those
weird things that I always. took for granted.. How does it pop and why does
it transform from a crunchy. kernel to fluffy
white popcorn?. I'm gonna need
some help for this.. Thankfully, National
Geographic Kids sent me. their expert in popcorn popping.. Here she is now!. ASHER: Hey Kamri!. I'm Asher Jay, a National
Geographic Explorer and a. creative conservationist.. My friends call me
the Popcorn Pilgrim.. I'm always looking for kernels
like yourself to transform.. KAMRI: Really?. ASHER: Yes, I used to be in
fashion and I'm a big fan of. instant makeovers.. Popcorn is an instant
makeover if I ever saw one.. KAMRI: OK, so what
are popcorn kernels?. Are they just dried
up pieces of corn?. ASHER: A popcorn kernel
is corn, just a different. species of corn than what
we eat at a barbeque.. A kernel of popcorn
has a stronger shell,. or hull, which makes it
better at trapping steam.. KAMRI: How does trapping steam
make a popcorn kernel pop?. ASHER: Each of these kernels
is like nature's little. pressure cooker.. When heat is
added to the seed,. the moisture inside
them turns to steam,. filling the inside
of the kernel.. KAMRI: Like a tea kettle!
ASHER: Exactly!. Except, the steam
has nowhere to go.. KAMRI: Because of the
kernel's strong hull.. ASHER: Bingo.. Eventually, enough steam
pressure builds inside the. kernel that it bursts
through the kernel's shell.. KAMRI: So is the popping the
sound of the shell breaking?. ASHER: It's actually the
sound of steam rushing
out of the kernel.. Kind of like the popping sound
of opening a soda bottle.. KAMRI: So what's the
white stuff of popcorn?. ASHER: That stuff is
the starch of the kernel.. It's stored food
the seed consumes. to grow into a sprout.. KAMRI: Popcorn is amazing!. To get a better perspective,
I think we'll have to see. one of those kernels
up close and personal.. ASHER: Yes. Wait, what?. KAMRI: We'll just
enlarge a popcorn seed. and see how it all works.. Stand back!. ASHER: Amazing! OK.. This is the seed's hull.
It protects the seed.. KAMRI: And also
traps the steam.. ASHER: This is the endosperm.. It's the starch that
is the seed's fuel to
grow into a plant.. KAMRI: So when
the kernel pops,. it bursts out of the
shell and becomes the. fluffy, tasty part of popcorn.. ASHER: And this is
the seed's germ.. It's the part of the plant
that would develop if the. seed were to grow on its own.. KAMRI: It's getting hot
in here, like a sauna.. ASHER: That's the steam,
building inside the shell.. KAMRI: Wait, that means
this kernel's ready to.. Whoa!. Now that you know
how that works,. catch up on all the other
episodes of How Things Work. by clicking right here.. And also make sure you
subscribe to Nat Geo Kids. by clicking down here.. See you next time. Bye!. Captioned by Cotter
Captioning Services.
